members.member: The index of this bone in the avatar structure
The Unity transform that relates to this object
The VG transform data pointer that relates to this object
Potential RigidBody on the bone for physical avatar, if have rigidbody should not have m_articulationBody
Potential ArticulationBody on the bone for physical avatar, if have articulationbody should not have m_rigidBody
Potential Rigidbody used to receive sensor controlled hand bone poses for physical avatar hand control
To which side of hand this bone belongs to, only assigned for physical avatar when creating collider now
TODO: improve this nested structure
Holds the transforms of the rig to be communicated with the VirtualGrasp library.
The avatar ID (should be unique, describing the identity of this avatar)
The avatar type (to handle different cases such as Poseable, Skeletal, ...)
The reset poses when switching the controlled hands.
A caching pointer for all the avatar transforms
A map of all bone indices (their position in the array) to their IDs (instance IDs).
A map of all bone handles from the transformIDs to the VG_Bones.
A map of all bone handles from a side and bone type to the corresponding VG_Bones.
A map of all bone handles from a side and bone type to the corresponding VG_Bones.
Each finger bone's mass for articulation body, and wrist/palm is 3 times of finger bone
Strength scale factor to articulation drive stiffness and forcelimit, [Range(0.1f, 10f)]

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_AvatarHandle.SetupHandPhysicalArticulation
member.summary: Setup hand using articulation body and connect with sensor body An alternative method for physical hand to SetupHandRigidbodies

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_AvatarHandle.SetupHandRigidbodies
member.summary: Setup hand as rigid bodies, not connected with joint now, and connect with sensor body An alternative method for physical hand to SetupHandPhysicalArticulation

members.member: Create hand colliders from VG
Map from the grasped game object to the grab joint
VG_SelectionSettings can be used to initialize the object and grasp selection settings.
VG_DebugSettings can be used to configure some debug options.
VG_GlobalGraspInteractionSettings is ued to configure global parameters of VirtualGrasp grasp interaction. @img

VG_ArticulationBase is an abstract class, so only inherited components (such as VG_Articulation) can be attached to an object. An articulation can be attached to an object that should follow an articulated constraint, such as a prismatic or revolute joint.
Contains changable object's VG_Articulation properties, i.e. parameters in ChangeObjectJoint()
The type of this articulated joint
If joint is free motion, otherwise limited

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_ArticulationProperty.m_limit
member.summary: The lower and upper limits of articulated joint. In unit (degree) if REVOLUTE or CONE, (meter) if PRISMATIC or PLANAR (along anchor's xaxis). For CONE joint, m_limit.x is swing angle limit, m_limit.y is twist angle limit.

members.member: The screw rate describes how much (>=0, in cm) to translate at one degree of rotation for revolute joint type. If set to 0 then is regular revolute joint without screwing in or out.
The lower and upper limits of planar joint along anchor's yaxis, in unity (meter)
The anchor local position w.r.t object
The anchor local rotation w.r.t object

VG_Articulation inherits from VG_ArticulationBase. An articulation can be attached to an object that should follow an articulated constraint, such as a prismatic or revolute joint. The anchor describes the axis of the constraint (such as the axis of movement for prismatic joints like buttons or drawers; or the axis of rotation for revolute joints such as wheels or levers). The push direction describes the direction of push for pushable objects. @img

VG_Interactable allows to specifiy interaction parameters specifically for an object. An VG_Interactable can be attached to an object that should follow a different interaction behavior than defined in the global VG_GraspInteractionSettings. @img
VG_HandProfile is a helper class to define specific hand profile to align hand model standards.
VG_ControllerProfile is a helper class to define specific sensor / controller configuration.
If this is a haptic device
The query grasp method for GetGrasp() function
Enum flag to describe what controller signals a sensor should cover.

An important information for designing your gameplay with VirtualGrasp is what to do dependent on what state the hand is in. For this purpose, VG_InteractionMode defines different interaction modes that are used by the library (such as grasping or empty). You can access a specific hand's mode through its VG_HandStatus.
ReturnCode for various VirtualGrasp functions. Most functions in this API provide such a return code.
Internal return code (native library to wrapper)
Action towards the grasp editor, see EditGrasp()
Enum for setting which (VR) controller buttons.
Enum bitmask to compose parts of a NetworkSignal
MatrixType is a helper class to define specific matrix properties that are important to describe a 4x4 matrix.
Flag for left-handed matrix type
Flag for right-handed matrix type
Flag for column-major matrix type
Flag for row-major matrix type
VG_VelocityTracker tracks object velocity when held by a hand.

VG_HandStatus is used as a helping data structure in which the most important grasp state of a hand is stored. Its use in the FixedUpdate() function of the MyVirtualGrasp.cs template will provide you with a good example on how to use the VG_HandStatus from the VirtualGrasp plugin.
We support two hands per avatar, left and right in this enum.
Need to know what type made the avatar registration for scaling.
Avatar's hand template type represented as URDF.
Different sensor (or controller) types that can be used by VirtualGrasp. Note only External Controller is supported.
Animation grasp type enum.
A humanoid hand gesture type enum.
An enum to describe how fingers are controlled.
An enum to describe a bone type, used for accessing of bones from outside the library.
Different articulated joint types supported by VG.
Whether the motion is free or limited
An enum to specify if an object is physical, and if physical by which unity component.
For labeling grasps (grasp editor functionality).
An enum to describe a hand interaction type (i.e. a mode on grasp visualization).
Decide when query grasp if hand moves and how to move hand.
An enum to specify which kind of method is used for pose-based grasp selection.
Identifier for a grasp synthesis algorithm.
Specify for an object how to constrain grasp synthesis.
Decide when query object transform which objects to get.
Return code for core API functions.
Object handler is a class that contains all functionality related to object handling and management. The PrivateController has one m_objectHandler.
A container for an error that can occur during object mesh processing (RegisterObjectMesh).
The error code
The object this error relates to
A message assigned to the error
A container for containing an array of transform datas that can be re-used at fixed length instead of being allocated during runtime.
The fixed array size
An array for data allocation
A helper handle to that array.
A map to manage the object handles, keyed by their game object IDs.
We need this list to keep the order of transforms for hierarchical operations (since the dictionary above does not assure order)
A map to manage unbaked objects, mainly for debug visualization, mapping what has been gone wrong.
Helper class to manage object handles that are returned from VG core lib.
An object which is in range and also moving, will exist only in m_inHandRangeObjectIds (updated every frame)
List of hidden object IDs (updated every frame)
List of moving object IDs (updated every frame)
A objects have already been sent to VG (updated every frame)
Flag if debug files shall be exported.
Flag if we first update global poses and then update local for all the hierarchy of objects (true will switch update to not follow order)
Get selected object for grasp or for push interactions
Get upstream movable vg object
Contains initial physical object's property from rigidbody or articulation body.
A VG_Object is the main container for any interactable object.
The Unity transform that relates to this object
The VG transform data pointer that relates to this object
The hash value of this object mesh (computed by VG)
The rigid body that relates to this object.
The articulated body that relates to this object.
If this object is physical or not (can change during runtime).
If this object's articulation body is a root
Cache object's physical property in DestroyObjectPhysicalProperty() when switch object to nonphysical to change to constrained VG articulation
Cache object's interpolation and use gravity in ConnectObject() when grabbing and recover when release physical object
Cache object's physical status if jump grasp on physical object by rigid body
Cache object's initial VG Articulation component
Cache object's initial VG Articulation property
Specify object joint change status
List of hands that are currently holding the object
List of hands that indirectly holding the object as an upstream movable object

The ObjectProcessor is a helper class to prepare and send object mesh data for being processed to the library. Different child classes send meshes for different purposes, mainly differing in the override of the Run() function.
If the content of the processor is valid
The hash of the object
A return code of the result of the processor
The transform data of the object
A handle to the object triangles
A handle to the object vertices
The ObjectProcessorForHashing sends mesh data to the VG library to compute the object hash.
The ObjectProcessorForExporting sends mesh data to the VG library to export an .obj file.
The ObjectProcessorForFallback sends mesh data to the VG library to compute a single bounding box as fallback for unbaked objects.
A class that provides a handle / pointer to a templated array so it can be used as argument for a library call.
Enum of different grasp request functions that can be called inside the library
A list of the VG_HandStatus
A map to manage the avatar handles, keyed by their instance IDs.
A list of the avatar handles that are controlled by sensor
The object handler takes care of all objects
Debug settings
Collider manager
Flag to store if grasp DB could be loaded.
Flag to pause VG
Clear the SelectionInterface from all pre-registered data. Can be used in case of a restart of the game.
Check if this SelectionInterface is initialized (and return a pointer to it). @return Pointer to this instance if initialized, NULL otherwise.
Initialize the VG_HandStatus with data from the plugin. @param avatarHandle The avatar handle.
Stop recording sensor signal and store to a file
Load recorded sensor signal from a file, but do not start replay
Load recorded sensor signal from a file, but do not start replay
Start replay all interactions on all hands in recorded SensorDB
Resume replay for the given avatar
Stop replay all interactions on all hands in recorded SensorDB
Start replay an interaction on one object on this hand side
Update the VG_HandStatus with data from the plugin.
NOTE: the parameters in this function has to be all covered by VG_ArticulationProperty defined in VGComponents.cs
Release this SelectionInterface, i.e. mainly wait for closing threads, and decouple the connected libraries.
This is the base class for each VirtualGraspInterface.
A map to manage the sensor setups, keyed by the avatar IDs they refer to.
The current status of the interface.
Managing potential native dependency libraries, key: library name; value: native library handle.
A map to manage the external controllers, keyed by the wrist IDs they refer to.
Register a rig.

member.name: T:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller
member.summary: This is the VirtualGrasp main controller and the public API to be used in Unity scripts after importing the plugin into the Unity scene.

members.member: The selection interface initialized towards the VirtualGrasp selection library.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnInitialize
member.summary: The event to call when we have successfully initialized the library.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectGrasped
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand has fully grasped an object. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectReleased
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand is starting to release an object. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectFullyReleased
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when an object is fully release by all hands. The Transform it carries includes the object that has just been released.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectPushed
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand pushing an object. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnHandEmptied
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand is switching from EMPTY mode to a non-empty mode.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnHandNonEmptied
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand is switching from a non-empty mode to EMPTY mode.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnUpstreamMovableObjectFullyReleased
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when an upstream movable object is fully release by all hands. The Transform it carries includes the object that has just been released.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnUpstreamMovableObjectFullyReleasedByHand
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when an upstream movable object is fully release by all hands. The Transform it carries includes the object that has just been released.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnUpstreamMovableObjectChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when an upstream movable object is changed.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnUpstreamMovableObjectRemoved
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when an upstream movable object is removed.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnGraspTriggered
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when a hand is starting to grasp an object. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectExit2HandMode
member.summary: This event is invoked in the frame when object is released by the 2nd grasping hand. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectCollided
member.summary: This event is invoked when a grasped object is colliding with another object. The VG_HandStatus it carries includes more information about the interaction.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectJointChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when an object's articulation / joint is changed. The VG_Articulation it carries includes more information about the joint.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectInternalJointChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when an object's joint is changed internally, but there is no VG_Articulation on object. The Transform carries which object changed the joint internally.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnObjectSelectionWeightChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when an object's selection weight is changed. The event carries the object for which the weight has been changed and the new weight.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnAvatarSpecificObjectSelectionWeightChanged
member.summary: This event is invoked when an avatar-specific object selection weight is changed. The event carries the object and avatarID for which the weight has been changed and the new weight.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnPreUpdate
member.summary: This event is invoked in the update loop before VG runs its update. Thus, all other scripts that should update before the VG cycle should listen to this event.

member.name: F:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.OnPostUpdate
member.summary: This event is invoked in the update loop after VG runs its update. Thus, all other scripts that should update after the VG cycle should listen to this event.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.Initialize
member.summary: Initialize the plugin.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.IsEnabled
member.summary: Check if the plugin has been initialized and is ready to use.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetDebugPath
member.summary: Return the path where VG stores debug files.
member.returns: The path (platform dependent).

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.FixedUpdate
member.summary: The FixedUpdate() heartbeat of the plugin.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.IsolatedUpdateDataIn
member.summary: The FixedUpdate() method has been divided into three parts: IsolatedUpdateDataIn(), IsolatedUpdate() and IsolatedUpdateDataOut() for application of the Burst compiler. IsolatedUpdateDataIn() isolates data communication from Unity to VG.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.IsolatedUpdate
member.summary: The Update() method has been divided into three parts: IsolatedUpdateDataIn(), IsolatedUpdate() and IsolatedUpdateDataOut() for application of the Burst compiler. IsolatedUpdate() runs the main update loop in VG.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.IsolatedUpdateDataOut
member.summary: The Update() method has been divided into three parts: IsolatedUpdateDataIn(), IsolatedUpdate() and IsolatedUpdateDataOut() for application of the Burst compiler. IsolatedUpdateDataOut() isolates data communication from VG to Unity.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetHands
member.summary: Receive an enumerator of all registered hands and their status.
member.returns: Enumerator over VG_HandStatus.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetHand(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide)
member.summary: Receive a specific hand and its status.
member.param: The avatar to get the hand status for.
The hand side to get the avatar from.
member.returns: A VG_HandStatus.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetAvatarID(UnityEngine.SkinnedMeshRenderer,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the AvatarID of the given skinned mesh renderer
member.param: The returned AvatarID.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode.SUCCESS on successful avatar id fetch, or VG_ReturnCode.INVALID_AVATAR if avatar is null.

members.member:
Get the AvatarID of the sensor controlled avatar when the avatar represents both left and right hands.
The returned AvatarID. Will be set to -1 upon error. VG_ReturnCode.SUCCESS on successful avatar id fetch, or VG_ReturnCode.DLL_FUNCTION_FAILED on an unexpected error. @remark No guarantee on returning the one that was first sensor controlled avatar

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetSensorControlledAvatarID(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the AvatarID(s) of the sensor controlled avatar(s) when each avatar represents both hand sides or just one hand side. If the avatar represents both hand sides then avatarIDLeft and avatarIDRight are identical.
member.param: The ID of sensor avatar that include left hand. Will be set to -1 upon error or if there is no sensor avatar representing left hand.
The ID of sensor avatar that include right hand. Will be set to -1 upon error or if there is no sensor avatar representing right hand.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Set if use the avatar for recording response states during sensor recording or replay.
The avatar id. If use this avatar to record response states in sensor db. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark When recordingStates is true, if avatar is used for sensor recording, then recording will also include response states, while if avatar is used for replay sensor db, then replay will update response states in the sensor db.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterReplayAvatar(UnityEngine.SkinnedMeshRenderer,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Register a new avatar during runtime.
member.param: The skinned mesh renderer of the model that should be registered to VG.
The new avatar ID will be assigned to this value after registration; -1 if it failed.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterRemoteAvatar(UnityEngine.SkinnedMeshRenderer,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Register a new remote avatar during runtime.
member.param: The skinned mesh renderer of the model that should be registered to VG.
If networking is used, these will be the networkingIDs of the left hand of the new avatar (we assume max 2 hands per avatar).
If networking is used, these will be the networkingIDs of the right hand of the new avatar (we assume max 2 hands per avatar).
The new avatar ID will be assigned to this value after registration; -1 if it failed.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterSensorAvatar(UnityEngine.SkinnedMeshRenderer,System.Int32@,VirtualGrasp.VG_SensorSetup)
member.summary: Register a new avatar during runtime. Single sensor controlling each hand.
member.param: The skinned mesh renderer of the model that should be registered to VG.
The new avatar ID will be assigned to this value after registration; -1 if it failed.
The primary sensor setup used to control the avatar.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterSensorAvatar(UnityEngine.SkinnedMeshRenderer,System.Int32@,VirtualGrasp.VG_SensorSetup,VirtualGrasp.VG_SensorSetup)
member.summary: Register a new avatar during runtime. Double sensor for each hand.
member.param: The skinned mesh renderer of the model that should be registered to VG.
The new avatar ID will be assigned to this value after registration; -1 if it failed.
The primary sensor setup used to control the avatar.
The secondary sensor setup used to control the avatar.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.UnRegisterAvatar(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unregister avatar during runtime
member.param: The id of the avatar to be unregistered.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterObject(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Sync a new object in the scene to the plugin, e.g. if the object is spawned.
member.param: The object that should be synced.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterObjects(System.Collections.Generic.List{UnityEngine.Transform})
member.summary: Sync new objects from the scene to the plugin, e.g. if these object are newly spawned.
member.param: The objects that should be synced.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Sync deleted objects from the scene to the plugin, e.g. if the object has been deleted.
The object that has been deleted. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Works only for distal objects.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.Clear
member.summary: Reset the plugin.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.Release
member.summary: Release the plugin.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SaveState(System.String)
member.summary: Save the object hierarchy debug state. This is done automatically when closing VirtualGrasp.

members.member:
Receive (from VG) a multiplayer broadcast message as a binary byte array.
A bitmask of network signals to request. Default is All. The message received by VG. @tag VG_NetworkManager

Specify an object to be grasped by a hand no matter how far the object is.
The avatar id The side of the hand The transform of the object that will be grasped by this hand VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Recommend to use "Jump Primary Grasp" interaction type on the object since otherwise dynamically generated grasp can be unnatural due to suboptimal hand placement.

Instantaneously switch the grasped object to specified object in the function.
The avatar id The side of the hand The transform of the object to switch to grasp VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Recommend to use "Jump Primary Grasp" interaction type on the object since otherwise dynamically generated grasp can be unnatural due to suboptimal hand placement.

Instantaneously switch the grasped object, and continously calling also toggle through primary grasps on this object.
The avatar id The side of the hand The transform of the object to switch to grasp and toggle primary grasps. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark The specified object should have JUMP_PRIMARY_GRASP interaction type and has added primary grasps in the grasp db.

Returns the avatar specific object selection weight of an object for interaction.
The avatar id Which object to specify weight The corresponding weight VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Note by default this weight is equal to the object's selection weight for all avatars. @remark Use case is mainly to specify relative selection preferences for cluttered objects.

Specify the avatar specific object selection weight of an object for interaction.
The avatar id Which object to specify weight Should be >=0 value to specify the preferences to select this object. If 0 exclude this object in selection process VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Note by default this weight is equal to the object's selection weight for all avatars. @remark Use case is mainly to specify different grasp preferences for avatars e.g. master vs. student grasp abilities.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.ClearAvatarSpecificObjectSelectionWeights(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clear all avatar specific object selection weights.
member.param: The avatar id
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetGraspButton
member.summary: Return the currently selected GraspButton.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetSensorPose(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide,UnityEngine.Vector3@,UnityEngine.Quaternion@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Receive the sensor pose of a given avatar and hand.
member.param: The avatar to get the pose from.
The hand side to get the pose from.
The returned position.
The returned rotation.
Set True (default) to return the absolute pose, and False to return the relative pose.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Get the current joint state of a single-dof articulated object. For planar joint, the joint state along xaxis of the joint anchor.
The object to get the current joint state value for. The returned joint state. Will be set to 0.0f upon error VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. when selectedObject is null, or VG_ReturnCode.DLL_FUNCTION_FAILED on an unexpected error.

Get the current secondary joint state along yaxis of joint anchor for planar articulated object.
The object to get the current joint state value for. The returned secondary joint state. Will be set to 0.0f upon error. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. when selectedObject is null, or VG_ReturnCode.DLL_FUNCTION_FAILED on an unexpected error.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetObjectJointState(UnityEngine.Transform,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the current joint to desired state for a single-dof articulated object or planar joint object.
member.param: The object to set the joint state value for.
The target joint state. If exceed joint limit will be constrained within limit.
The target secondary joint state for Planar joint. If exceed joint limit will be constrained within limit.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Change a set of prameters of an object's joint in runtime.
The object to change the object joint parameters. The new joint type. The new motion type specifying if motion should be limited or free. The new anchor transform. The new limit of the new joint type. For planar joint this is the limit along xaxis of the anchor transform. The new screw rate (>=0, in cm per degree) for revolute joint. The new limit along yaxis of the anchor transform for planar joint. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark If new_screwRate is set to 0 then rotating of revolute object will not move object position along the joint axis. @remark Recommend to use this in LateUpdate to guarantee object pose is in sync with VirtualGrasp library.

Change an object's joint and all other articulation parameters in runtime.
The object to change the joint for. An articulation describing the new articulation parameters. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Recommend to use this in LateUpdate to guarantee object pose is in sync with VirtualGrasp library.

Get object's original or current joint type.
The object to get the current joint state value for. If true, get the original joint type, otherwise the current type. The returned joint type. Will be set to FLOATING upon error. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. when selectedObject is null, or VG_ReturnCode.DLL_FUNCTION_FAILED on an unexpected error.

Recover an object's original joint, after it has been changed by ChangeObjectJoint().
The object to recover the joint for. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark Recommend to use this in LateUpdate to guarantee object pose is in sync with VirtualGrasp library.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetDualHandsOnly(UnityEngine.Transform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set if an object can only be manipulated by dual hands from a same avatar.
member.param: The object to change the dual hand type for.
If dual hand only.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.summary: Return all interactable objects.

member.returns: All interactable objects in the scene.

member.summary: Return all interactable objects from the editor scene.

If to exclude objects that have been untagged in the scene.
member.returns: All interactable objects in the editor scene.

An output list of avatar-handside-pairs describing which hands are currently grasping that object.

member.summary: Return all unbaked objects.
member.returns: A list of all unbaked objects in the scene as Unity Transforms.

members.member:
Send an external controller grab signal to the plugin (for EXTERNAL_CONTROLLER sensors).
The avatar to set external sensor pose for. The hand side to set external sensor pose for. The grab strength signal to set. @tag VG_ExternalControllerManager

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.RegisterExternalControllers(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{VirtualGrasp.VG_ExternalController}})
member.summary: Register the external controllers that should be processed in each frame.
member.param: A dictionary of external controllers (map from wrist ID to VG_ExternalControllers in order of priority).

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.IsMissingSensorData(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide)
member.summary: Check if a hand has invalid sensor data.
member.param: The avatar to check for.
The hand side to check for.
member.returns: True if sensor data is invalid, False otherwise.

members.member:
Set the active state of the sensor(s) that control the specified hand of an instance avatar.
The avatar id. The side of the hand (remark: UNKNOWN will not have any effect). If the sensor(s) that control this hand should be active or not. If a hand is deactivated, its position will be reset to here (default (0,0,0)). @remark By default sensors are all active, and this function can be used in runtime to change this.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetAvatarActive(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Set the active state of the avatar sensor(s) and mesh.
member.param: The avatar id.
If the sensor(s) that control this hand should be active or not.
If the mesh of this hand should be visible or not.
If an avatar is deactivated, hand positions will be reset to here (default (0,0,0)).

members.member:
Enable or disable finger calibration mode (FCM).
During enabled FCM, the hand opening range will be calibrated. After disabling it, grasp and release signals will work in this range. The avatar for which to enable/disable FCM. True for enabling FCM, False for disabling it.

Enable or disable wrist calibration mode (WCM). During enabled WCM, different ranges of motion of the wrist or grab strength will be calibrated.
@remark untested The avatar for which to enable/disable WCM. True for enabling WCM, False for disabling it.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetGrabStrength(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide)
member.summary: Returns the current grab strength of a hand. The grab strength is 0 for a fully open hand, 1 for a fully closed hand.
member.param: The avatar to receive the grab strength for.
The hand side to receive the grab strength for.
member.returns: The current grab strength of the [side] hand.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetGrabVelocity(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide)
member.summary: Returns the current grab velocity of a hand. The current velocity of the grab strength (see GetGrabStrength), so negative when the hand is opening, and positive when the hand is closing.
member.param: The avatar to receive the grab velocity for.
The hand side to receive the grab velocity for.
member.returns: The current grab velocity of the [side] hand.

members.member:
Change the sensor offset in runtime. The sensor offset is the offset between the pose that the current sensor is measuring and where the virtual hand is appearing in the scene.
@remark Also treating left hand (LHS) and right hand (RHS) is considered, so the offset is applied symmetrically. The avatar to set the offset for. The sensor type to change the offset for. The offset position. Set to null if position should not be modified. The offset rotation. Set to null if rotation should not be modified. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Get the AvatarID of the replay avatar when the avatar represents both left and right hands.
The returned AvatarID. Will be set to -1 upon error. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark No guarantee on returning the one that was first registered as replay avatar

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetReplayAvatarID(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the AvatarID(s) of the replay avatar(s) when each avatar represents both hand sides or just one hand side. If the avatar represents both hand sides then avatarIDLeft and avatarIDRight are identical.
member.param: The ID of replay avatar that include left hand. Will be set to -1 upon error or if there is no replay avatar representing left hand.
The ID of replay avatar that include right hand. Will be set to -1 upon error or if there is no replay avatar representing right hand.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Save recording sensor data and store the whole sequence to a file
The fullpath of the filename to save the recording to. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Collect recording sensor data.
[output] vg sensor recording. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Collect recording sensor data.
[output] byte array containing the sensor recording. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Load recorded sensor data from a file, but do not start replay
The full path to load the recording from. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Load recorded sensor data from a byte array.
The byte array to load the recording from. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Get the starting wrist poses for full replay of the whole interaction sequence.
The ID of the avatar to play the recording on (note: it has to be an avatar enabled for replay). If provided, the entire sensor recording will transformed in to object's frame. If not, in global frame. The position of the left wrist. The orientation of the left wrist. The position of the right wrist. The orientation of the right wrist. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @remark LoadRecording need to be called before this to load recorded sensor data. @remark SetProcessByRecordedFrame need to be called before this to set this avatar to be enabled for replay. @tag VG_Recorder

Start full replay of the whole interaction sequence on an avatar.
The ID of the avatar to play the recording on (note: it has to be an avatar enabled for replay). If provided, the entire sensor recording will be replayed in this object's frame. If not, in global frame. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Resume replaying of an avatar.
The ID of the avatar to resume replaying the recording on (note: it has to be an avatar enabled for replay). VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Stop replay of the recorded interaction sequence on an avatar.
The ID of the avatar to play the recording on (note: it has to be an avatar enabled for replay). VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Start replaying a specific interaction segment on one object.
The object to play the interaction on. The avatar to play the interaction with. The hand to play the interaction with. The ID of the interaction segment to be played on this object. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_Recorder

Check if a hand is currently replaying a recorded sensor data.
The avatar to check. The hand to check. True if replaying, False otherwise. @tag VG_Recorder

Force the release of a grasp.
The avatar to release grasps on all its hands. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag untested

Force the release of a grasp.
The avatar to release a grasp for. The hand which to release the grasp for. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag untested

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.MakeGesture(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide,VirtualGrasp.VG_GestureType)
member.summary: Make a gesture with a hand.
member.param: The avatar to make gesture for.
The hand which to make gesture for.
The gesture to make with the [side] hand of avatar [avatarID].
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.ReleaseGesture(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide)
member.summary: Release a gesture on a hand.
member.param: The avatar to release a grasp for.
The hand which to release the grasp for.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Query what is the gesture a hand is forming, holding or releasing at the moment.
The avatar to query gesture status for. The hand on which to query gesture status. Output, the current gesture type the hand is in. @remark If gesture output is UNKNOWN_GESTURETYPE, that means the hand is not forming, holding or releasing any gesture, but at a complete gesture-empty state.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetBlockRelease(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify if on this hand should block release or not in runtime.
member.param: The avatar to release a grasp for.
If block release signal or not on this avatar.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetBlockRelease(System.Int32,VirtualGrasp.VG_HandSide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify if on this hand should block release or not in runtime.
member.param: The avatar to release a grasp for.
The hand which to release the grasp for.
If block release signal or not on this hand.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Set the global interaction type method. The interaction type defines how the hand and the object should get together during a grasp.
@remark This will overwrite the specific grasp interaction type (see SetInteractionTypeForObject) for all objects. The method to switch to for all objects. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the interaction type for a selected object. The interaction type defines how the hand and the object should get together during a grasp.
@remark This will overwrite the global interaction type (see SetGlobalInteractionType) for that object. The avatar which is selecting an object. The hand which is selecting an object. The interaction type to switch to for the object that is selected by the [side] hand of avatar [avatarID]. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the interaction type for a selected object. The interaction type defines how the hand and the object should get together during a grasp.
@remark This will overwrite the global interaction type (see SetGlobalInteractionType) for that object. The object to modify the interaction type for. The interaction type to switch to for the object. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the global throw velocity scale. The throw velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of linear movement.
@remark This will overwrite the specific throw velocity scale (see SetThrowVelocityScaleForObject) for all objects. The throw translational velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the throw velocity scale for a selected object. The throw velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of linear movement.
@remark This will overwrite the global throw velocity scale (see SetGlobalThrowVelocityScale) for that object. The avatar which is selecting an object. The hand which is selecting an object. The throw translational velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the throw velocity scale for a selected object. The throw velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of linear movement.
@remark This will overwrite the global throw velocity scale (see SetGlobalThrowVelocityScale) for that object. The object to modify the throw velocity scale for. The throw translational velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the global throw angular velocity scale. The throw angular velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of rotation movement.
@remark This will overwrite the specific throw angular velocity scale (see SetThrowAngularVelocityScaleForObject) for all objects. The throw angular velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the throw angular velocity scale for a selected object. The throw angular velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of rotation movement.
@remark This will overwrite the global throw angular velocity scale (see SetGlobalThrowAngularVelocityScale) for that object. The avatar which is selecting an object. The hand which is selecting an object. The throw angular velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

Set the throw angular velocity scale for a selected object. The throw angular velocity scale defines how powerful the throw is in terms of rotation movement.
@remark This will overwrite the global throw angular velocity scale (see SetGlobalThrowAngularVelocityScale) for that object. The object to modify the throw velocity scale for. The throw angular velocity scale. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.SetObjectAffordances(UnityEngine.Transform,VirtualGrasp.VG_Affordances)
member.summary: Set the affordances for a selected object.
member.param: The object to modify the affordances for.
The affordances to switch to for this object.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Return the pose (i.e. position and orientation) of a specific bone.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The BoneType to get. The returned pose of the bone. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Return the Transform that corresponds to a provided instance ID.
The instance ID. The Transform that corresponds to the transformID. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Return the pose (i.e. position and orientation) of a specific bone.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The BoneType to get. The returned ID of the bone transform. The returned position of the bone. The returned rotation of the bone. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Return the pose matrix of a specific bone.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The BoneType to get. The returned ID of the bone transform. The returned pose matrix of the bone. The Unity Transform that corresponds to the requested bone. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Return the pose of a specific finger bone as a matrix.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The finger to get the bone pose from (from 0 as thumb to 4 as pinky). The bone index (from 0 as proximal to N as distal) to get the bone pose from. Use -1 for fingertip. The returned ID of the bone transform. The returned pose of the bone. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Return the pose (i.e. position and orientation) of a specific finger bone.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The finger to get the bone pose from (from 0 as thumb to 4 as pinky). The bone index (from 0 as proximal to N as distal) to get the bone pose from. Use -1 for fingertip. The returned ID of the bone transform. The returned position of the bone. The returned rotation of the bone. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

Reflect the pose of a specific bone on a Transform.
The avatar to get the bone pose from. The hand side to get the bone pose from. The finger to get the bone pose from (from 0 as thumb to 4 as pinky). The bone index (from 0 as proximal to N as distal) to get the bone pose from. Use -1 for fingertip. The returned pose of the bone. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_HandVisualizer

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetGrasp(System.UInt32,VirtualGrasp.VG_GraspDB@)

GraspDB containing grasp information for object with hash objectHash.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetGrasp(System.UInt32,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Get grasp information in raw byte format by objectHash.
member.param: Hash of the object for which to retrieve the grasp db.
Byte array with (encrypted) grasp information for object with hash objectHash.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

member.summary: Loads grasp db.
member.param: grasp db to be loaded.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.
member.exception: In case of incorrect data format.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.LoadGrasp(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Loads object-specific grasp db.
member.param: Byte stream of object-specific grasp db.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.
member.exception: In case of incorrect data format.

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.DeleteGrasp(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes object-specific grasp db. Won't delete grasp if there still exists one or more registered objects with objectHash.
member.param: Hash of the object to delete.
member.returns: VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call.

members.member:
Call grasp editor functionality on a currently selected object and grasp.
The avatar to call grasp editor functionality on. The hand side to call grasp editor functionality on. The grasp editor function / action to call. The object to call the action on (if not provided, the object in the hand). The grasp ID to call the action on (if not provided, the current grasp of the hand). VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag movie:https://youtu.be/40kYLBKhmqk?list=TLGGpdQGi0diO7gxNjExMjAyMg @tag VG_GraspStudio

member.name: M:VirtualGrasp.VG_Controller.GetInteractionTypeForObject(UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Get the current interaction type assigned to an object.
member.param: The object to receive the interaction type for.
member.returns: VG_InteractionType describing the current interaction type of the object.

members.member:
Receive a grasp in the grasp DB by index.
The object to receive a grasp for. The avatar to receive a grasp for. The hand side to receive a grasp for. The index of grasp to receive. The received wrist position of the grasp. The received wrist orientation of the grasp. The received VG_GraspType of the grasp. The received VG_GraspLabel of the grasp. Can be used to define if and how the grasp should be applied also. Can be used to define how the graspIndex should be interpreted. VG_ReturnCode describing the error state of the function call. @tag VG_GraspStudio

Receive the number of saved grasps in the grasp db for a specific object, and optionally a specified hand.
The object to get the number of available grasps for. If a valid avatarID together with handSide, receive only the available grasps for this hand (otherwise all available grasps). If a valid handSide together with avatarID, receive only the available grasps for this hand (otherwise all available grasps). The number of saved grasps in the grasp db for the selected object (either all or for the specified hand). @tag VG_HintVisualizer

Receive the number of primary grasps in the grasp db for a specific object, and optionally a specified hand.
The object to get the number of available grasps for. If a valid avatarID together with handSide, receive only the primary grasps for this hand (otherwise all available grasps). If a valid handSide together with avatarID, receive only the primary grasps for this hand (otherwise all available grasps). The number of primary grasps in the grasp db for the selected object (either all or for the specified hand). @tag VG_HintVisualizer
